Reviews.Title: “Clean and cheap budget hotel in little india area”
Reviews.Author: rupisces
Reviews.Content: clean and budget hotel just in the Little India area .famous Mustafa market is just 5 minutes.Metro rail station is 10 minutes walk.Hop on hop off tour buses and bus station is very near just at mustafa market.Cheap indian food is available in the area.Nice to stay here.Tea/coffe maker in the room

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and place”
Reviews.Author: GMBAIG
Reviews.Content: Very good place and near to bus station, metro train and the famous Mustafa centre. South asian will enjoying to live at this place all local foods of south asian are available and a Masjid for the Muslims for prayer. As far as Hotel, it is good, nice and clean with restaurant. So, it is worth to stay here with this budget.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in Little India of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Akashbansal
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Its a budget hotel in Little India part of Singapore. Its greatest strength is that it is walking distance from Mustafa Shopping Centre from where most of the shopping is done. Also it is very close to roadside Indian restaurants which are again budget category. So Indian food is abundantly available. There is Indian restaurant in the hotel itself. The location is bit untidy but very well connected to all parts of Singapore. There is a famous Indian temple also at some distance. Taxi is available at the gate of the hotel very easily. Rooms are comfortable and service is good. They provide all the facilities in the room like fridge, kettle, clothing iron etc. I will recommend this hotel to everyone and specially to Indian travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at cheap price”
Reviews.Author: uchitshah
Reviews.Content: Stay here for 3 nights last week of Dec 2011. Staff is good and rooms are also quite compared to what ppl say in trip advisor. Room service was also upto the mark. And location is little india is also excellent. So worth staying in this hotel if u wanna stay in little india. Bathroom are also clean n neat. Rooms are not so spacious but still good enough. They also provide locker in every rooms.

Reviews.Title: “broadway hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandybaroda
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights, its a decent hotel, chinese run, rooms although small are value in this expensive city. there is good connectivity, the buses are 20 feet away and the little india and fare mrt are a short walk. excellent location i beleive. there is good food and shopping available close by and the small lanes and alleys are open till late. good expereince.

Reviews.Title: “Great street/location in Little India”
Reviews.Author: helenpiela
Reviews.Content: This hotel worked out cheapest and most handy for public transport in Singapore where most hotels are so expensive. We are used to Indian standards, so the rooms were fine, aircon, hot water, comfy beds, little sound proofing, poor finish and a friendly lizard on the window. Lovely cafes at the front to get breakfast and great indian meals, including plenty veggie options. Handy to Farrer Park MRT. I was glad I booked this one, as the area has a really nice feel to it and it did everything we wanted it to do.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in Indian District”
Reviews.Author: ronniethedevil
Reviews.Content: Hotel was quite cheap in heart of Little India right next to the temple. Its quite close to the MRT station and almost could say in the heart of the city. There are other better budget hotels too but most of them would fall in the red light district so this would be a little better option. Around the hotel there are lot of cheap food joints where they serve you Indian food. But those are cheap joints for good quality Indian Food prefer to go to Boat Quay.

Reviews.Title: “All ok for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: pbcmehul
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 Rooms in this Hotel by Holiday City.com. Good Location in Little India. All overindia & Indians seen on the street. You dont feel that you are in Singapore. Many Indian Restaurant & Mustafa Centre nearby. For the Price of 90 SGD you cant expect more.They allotted 2 rooms one in front & 1 in back. Front room is big but very noisy & backrooms are small but quiet. Very Old furnishing but rooms are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Ok only, nothing exciting.”
Reviews.Author: jemimahileah
Reviews.Content: I went here because we had an emergency wherein my husband had to detour to another country right after landing in Singapore. So I booked this at 2am in the airport hotel booking system with the intention of booking only for the night and this was the cheapest I could find that wasn't in the red light district of Geylang. PRO's: *RELATIVELY cheaper price compared to other Singapore hotels. (my booking rate was 100sgd / night) *not too far from an MRT station. *its actually not as bad as it looks from outside. CON's: *its in Little India... what can I say. It's not the best place in Singapore. *you can hear the noise outside. not good if you've traveled for more than 10 hrs, endured a stressful emergency situation until 2am and just want to sleep in peace and quiet. *Outrageous price for internet (2 sgd / 30 mins) < at a time when other hotels offer free wifi to attract guests, they are absolutely doing the opposite. It's repulsive how exhorbitant they charge. I had to go out with my laptop and look for a wifi hotspot from Wireless@SG which is a free wifi service from the SG government. *Outside appearance looks very dodgy. I was a bit scared when I first got to this hotel thinking "oh man.... this is going to be interesting". Luckily, the inside rooms do not look as bad as the outside. *100sgd / night for this is not really worth it. Better go find other hotels, if you can. I was only caught in an emergency moment. Overall, I wouldn't go here. There are other better hotels at about the same range.

Reviews.Title: “good buget hotel”
Reviews.Author: SABBOY
Reviews.Content: Dear all, the hotel was good as per the pricing.it has two resturent in it which have very good food. best part is it is in little india and near to mustafa so good indian food and 24 hr shopping. Just near to bus stop and MRT station

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hotels2011
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Broadway for 3 days. I found that the hotel location is fantastic.Surrounded by Indian restaurants .Room size is small but they are clean. The bath room size is very small. The bath room door is white coloured arylic sheet and you can see the shadow of the person inside the bathroom clearly. This does not give a good feeling. Rest fine.

Reviews.Title: “A very good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: sangitajhunjhunwala
Reviews.Content: We went there and do the booking 15 days before.It was nice hotel with reasonable price.Beds are quiet comfortable. It is opposite to the famous mustafa market.It has its own resturant providing international food,tea ,coffee etc. There are lots of food joints for vegetarian and non-vegetarian people.It has very good room service.It has its own computer room with the internet facility. It is 5 min walk from the farrer park MRT and it is very near to the bus stop also. Taxis are easily available from there.It is good to stay here and it is giving the value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: Ramnatarajan
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance of Little India and Mustafa and Metro station. There is also a bus stop right in front of the hotel. They also give extra bed for children (at some extra cost). They allowed early check-in also.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Terrible Attitude of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AntOO7
Reviews.Content: Either the hotel is getting good business (so dont care) or thats the usual attitude of the front office staff but they deal with guests very rudely. even the basic requests are handled roughly as if they're doing you some kind of a favour and the tone of voice is high pitched like some school teacher in some strict school. The rooms were an average size. Not very spacious. We were given room on the 7th floor facing the road. For the kind of money they charge, its definitely not value for money. When all the other hotels offer free wifi in rooms, this hotel charges for it which is ridiculous. And they'll only sell 5 hour (non stop) packages. So who wants to travel to Singapore and stay holed up in the hotel for 5 hours. Why not sell hourly packages? They seem to know it yet they sell only 5 hour packages because its the attitude. Doesnt seem very smart business. The hotel seems to be managed by some very conservative people who dont give a damn about pleasing people. The attitude is "they're tourists, they're not going to come back anyway, so why not rip them off". They give Breakfast coupons for S$10 per room per day for the Indian restaurant next door. But the food there is so lousy that we ended up tearing the coupons and having breakfast elsewhere. The coupon system seems to be more to promote the restaurant than to serve the guests of the hotel. Overall, you get a sense that this hotel doesnt care about you as guests. They say that they have satellite tv in your room but only 4 chinese channels. The hotel seemed to be full of Indians but not a single English channel (forget regional indian channels) so whats the point?. They charge you for the extra bed, but once you put the bed, there is hardly any walking space. and they wont give you an extra blanket. The AC is so small and installed in one corner that it wont cool the room. The shower in the bathroom has been installed not keeping the guests comfort in mind but to save water. The water pressure is so low that it'd take a long time to have a bath. In the evenings, right outside the hotel on the side walk, you see prostitutes standing around waiting for customers. So not a very nice place if your're travelling with your family or children. Most of the flights come in very early in the morning. When we came to the hotel tired after the flight, the hotel doesnt even have a lobby with seats for more than 2 guests. Rest have to either stand (max standing space is 8 people) or get out. They can politely say that they'll have a room available at 11AM. But they rudely tell you "You have to come back later, come back later", waving their hands to say go; as if you're at some kind of a shelter or something. It puts you off immediately. We know that even this feedback will not have any impact on their attitude. This is basically intended to warn others to avoid this place. Its too expensive for the service and their attitude stinks. Everything about this hotel is to rip you off. There are better places for the price. It leaves a bitter after taste in your mouth and spoils your vacation. Because you make your first impressions about Singapore and its people from the staff at the hotel that you stay in. And this hotel is a very bad ambassador for Singapore. So Singapore Tourism, take note.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rakesh37
Reviews.Content: Rooms are surprisingly big with big wondow overlooking city and bathrooms are pretty big too again with big size windows Basically it is a 2 star hotel but compared to what I paid and going by its location which is next to Little India and Mustafa Center, I must say it is the best bet Cons: Rooms are very noisy as the hotel is next to Seragoon Road with vehicles plying 24 hours. Carpets of the hotel are very old. There are many eateries at stone throw away from the hotel. Not ideal for remance

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel within walking distance to many Indian shops/eateries”
Reviews.Author: csrao57
Reviews.Content: A very basic hotel in the city center near to the famous shopping Mustaffa shopping mall and SIM LIM square walking distance to the underground metro.The hotel has two restaurants serving good Indian food .

Reviews.Title: “Its Ok type hotel”
Reviews.Author: renuks
Reviews.Content: This hotel located in heart of little india.Location is awesome.But the service is not upto the mark.For me the TV wasnt working properly when i asked them for repair it took a long for them to respond.AC was not working.When i got some call from my local friends when im not in my room they didnt care about informing me.Later i found when i call them.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located”
Reviews.Author: saeedstone
Reviews.Content: 1. Convenient location 2. Value for money 3. Well designed rooms 4. Adequate amenities/facilities

Reviews.Title: “Good location; good only for sleeping in; you wouldn't want to spend time there.”
Reviews.Author: frizzy63
Reviews.Content: We are from Australia and we chose this hotel because of cost factors. I think we were the only Anglo Saxon people in the hotel. Singapore is very expensive and this was one of the cheapest places plus we wanted the location of not being in the centre of the Western section of Singapore. We stayed there for 7 nights. Well, we certainly got culture. We loved that aspect of it observing the Indian people and eating the food and being part of the atmosphere. The hotel itself was quite grubby but adequate. The beds were comfortable and felt clean (just the carpet ) and the shower was good and basically we left the hotel at 8 in the morning and didn't return until 8 or 9 in the evenings just to sleep so it served its purpose. Cheap shopping and lots of good food. Close to Little India train station which we used every day. Tried the buses but they weren't as efficient. Staff were friendly to us but didn't give out accurate information. So do your own research and don't rely on their information cos invariably they were wrong. We nearly missed the Night Säfari due to their inaccurate information. Air conditioning worked well except for the lack of free wifi. They charged you $5 for 2 hours which was ridiculously high. Or $1 for half and hour on their computers downstairs. My teenage son and daughter were okay with this hotel. If you want a cheap place to stay in a good location and you don't plan to spend too much time there; just simply sleep then it is fine. It served us well for what we wanted.

Reviews.Title: “A BUDGET HOTEL IN GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: niraj1971
Reviews.Content: The hotel’s main plus point is its location. It is situated in Little India area near Mustafa market. The Ferrer Park MRT station is also just a few minutes walk from here. Hotel does not have its own restaurant. But, Indian food is available in nearby restaurants. Overall it is a hotel for the tourists with economy budget and also for the Indians who starve for Indian food.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Budget”
Reviews.Author: Joll32
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated in good location on main road in Little India, you can go by foot to colonial district its about 20 mins walk or you can take a cab.Breakfast is in the reastaurant next the hotel, food si Good and tasty. Rooms are small and basic. For the price i was satisfied. For one max. two nights its ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if short on budget”
Reviews.Author: sidney_jec
Reviews.Content: I regret staying in this hotel. rooms were filthy. service poor. the only good thing about this hotel is its location. located next to Mustafa and MRT station it can be considered for Indian travellers. but a big NO otherwise. breakfast was included but wasn't worth giving a shot. all in all avoid it if you can. the Park on Kitchner road nearby is rather a good option but you'll have to loosen your purse strings.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: ankit_p
Reviews.Content: one of the mpst cost effective hotel in little india. its very close to Mustafa. The room in whichi stayed was very spacious. they have an internet cafe but you have to pay for using it. I didnt tried the food there but there was many good options near by.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Supratim_10
Reviews.Content: Had just been to Singapore and stayed 4 nights in Hotel Broadway. This is a good hotel for Indians, given the fact that it is 3-4 minutes walk from mustafa and this hotel is right in the middle of little india. MRT(Farrer-Park) is just 3-4 minutes walk and there is a bus stop right in front of the hotel. Delhi Restraunt and Amber restraunt at the ground floor of this hotel provides good north indian food, and there are tonnes of other indian food options in the vicinity(anand bhaban, komalas and shakuntala's to name a few). Given all these plus points in terms of location, the hotel rooms are a shade untidy, the carpet needs cleaning, the bathrooms are small, and the reception is not not overly helpful(they will just respond to what you ask and not more). But who cares, if you are in singapore for vaccation this is a good hotel to spend your nights, go shopping in mustafa and do sighseeing during the day. I would recommend this to "budget conscious Indian traveller"

Reviews.Title: “Lousy”
Reviews.Author: rajhemworld
Reviews.Content: For about 100 SGD, the rooms were some ancient caves, small windows, old funritures, TV channels all hazy & blurred. The staff at reception were some disinterested characters & very rude. Only good thing is it is bang opposite to Mohd Mustafa the shopping centre & some Indian Restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Alrite considering the budget”
Reviews.Author: Riku27
Reviews.Content: Location is good splly for indians but very unfriendly staff splly the chinese ones at reception during day. Rooms are small.. I paid for an extra bed and it was just a foldable one with different blankets than normal beds. When I asked for normal blanket I was told extra bed can only have those netted blankets. Like its written in Singapore constitution. Some lights were not working and one electrical socket was also not working. CRT TV with less channels and poor reception - doesn't matter tho' u wont go to Singapore to watch TV. No free Wifi in room.. have to pay to use pc in the hotel $1 for 30 mins. Better use the cafe outside $1.5 for an hour which stays open 24 hrs. If compared to other budget hotels I guess this works out tho.

Reviews.Title: “a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: Jan0s
Reviews.Content: Clean, pleasant and well located both for the colourful Little India district and the city centre, the Broadway Hotel was a perfect bolt hole for our stay in Singapore. The friendly and helpful staff made our stay very comfortable. With decent sized rooms that won't break bank, the Broadway is the ideal budget hotel. HIghly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to be remembered”
Reviews.Author: pugalk
Reviews.Content: Hotel Broadway in singapore is centrally placed where you can visit all places with a MRT station near by,service was very good,room was excellent,in all it was value for money.

Reviews.Title: “budget best”
Reviews.Author: KPSC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is best for budget travelers as this gives best of connectivity of MRT mustafa sim lim bugis etc etc.. great hotel at gr8 price.

Reviews.Title: “Have yet to find a better alternative”
Reviews.Author: Wantiga
Reviews.Content: I have been using the Broadway Hotel for visits to Singapore over the last five years. Tried a number of other hotels but came running back to this one. While limited in some ways, by comparison to other options in the same price range it is a standout. The lack of a drinks’ fridge and poor television reception and channel choice discourage spending too much time in the rooms but if you are going to Singapore to get out and do things then the convenience of staying in reasonable comfort in Little India, one the most colourful and vibrant quarters of the island republic, makes up for any shortcomings. Transport options, from inexpensive taxis to bus and subway, are all available at the door or close by. A pleasant extended stroll through Bugis Junction area, then past Raffles and the Esplanade Mall, takes you to the Singapore River with its clubs, bars and skyscrapers. Around the Little India quarter are wonderful restaurants and eateries such as the Gayatri on Race Course Road, the Tikka Centre food hall, an excellent 24 hour Indian, the CMK 2001, down the side road (Syed Alwi) at the Mustafa Centre, as well as an old style Chinese Coffee Shop with a choice of dishes including chilli crab (live mud crabs and cold beer) on Dickson and Jalan Besar corner to list just a few. I'm looking forward to returning for a visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Fit”
Reviews.Author: gktshiva
Reviews.Content: Hello, This is ideally suited for people from India visiting Singapore. Located near the Mustafa shopping plaza it is surrounded by a bunch of Restruants serving cuisine around the world. Infact there is an indian restruant in the first level of this hotel. So if you are someone who never wants to miss home food then this place is for you. This hotel does fall into the economy range. It is ideally suited for families to stay. Quite Safe. There is a water tap provided at every level for dringing water and the bathrooms do have a bathtub. Fun for your kids. There is also a Internet cafe below which provides browsing at an affordable cost. The last day at singapore is usually left for shopping, if this is so with you then you better stay here. There are few places around this area you can go around and try to utilize the available time. I really reccomend this hotel for a economy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: angkasa
Reviews.Content: Good location, service was good only problem was the noise from the street otherwise no complains

Reviews.Title: “very cheap hotel for family”
Reviews.Author: viralkumar
Reviews.Content: the rooms are small but clean and convenient,hot water anytime available, nothing to complain of at this price you cannot find comparitively in singapore very near by mustafa centre\ ok for one person not for family at all

Reviews.Title: “Ok...”
Reviews.Author: Nishir
Reviews.Content: An Ok hotel, located in Little India. The rooms were small and yet clean. The staff was not very friendly and asked for tip. On giving him, demanded a $ extra... consider it only as a transit hotel (which we did too)...

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to be in Little India”
Reviews.Author: Palan
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel for the low budget we had. Very much in heart of Little India. Simple clean rooms. Not much on the service. A simple good Restaurant at the ground floor is a treat for Vegetarians like us. In all a good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Crammed room with smelly linen.”
Reviews.Author: nirmal007
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Broadway hotel for a few days after week or so in Malaysia. I had a friend book this hotel, so walked in without realizing what I was in for. This is a real budget hotel with crammed rooms, old linen and average service. If you are looking for a pleasant time in Singapore then I highly recommend a higher quality hotel else you will end up like me waiting for your plane home.

Reviews.Title: “Heart of Indian Zone & Cheap Shopping in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: indfo
Reviews.Content: F1 in Malaysia was calling and had planned to visit KL and Singapore with my school friend, an office colleague, and a friend's friend. We were looking at the cheapest options available in Singapore and Broadway gave a mix of low cost with easy accessibility to Indian food (vegetarian). This hotel is right opposite to the biggest shopping place in Singapore, i.e the Mustaffa centre. It is also about 5 minutes walk from the nearest metro station. I give this hotel a thumbs-up for the location and availability of good Indian food nearby. I mentioned cheap... it’s one of the cheapest in Singapore, but unfortunately the cheapness translates to the place too. It’s not too well maintained nor has good facilities. The reception is as cramped as it can be and the facilities in the room are not great either! But why in the remotest possibility would I spend anything more than 5-6 hours of sleep & bath in a hotel staying in awesome Singapore! It’s just a place to rest (read Sleep) as soon as you get in... And wake up and leave the place as soon as you wake up! This place was best for it! It’s a decent location for the cost. Best if using it as “dump yourself” place during a quick vacation in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “ok ok hotel, stay for its location and rooms charges is low”
Reviews.Author: IndiaNatasha
Reviews.Content: we stayed there because of it's location which is good if u r indian and want to be near indian food but yah connectivity is amazing though eating outside hotel is a better advise and rooms and bathroom are small very basic......................... rest staff and recpton is not so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nazimkazi
Reviews.Content: Guys THis is the best budget hotel i can say,very clean and the location is just 2 min from Mustafa shopping centre little india,you will get number of local and clean restaurents just you walk out of this hotel,where you can enjoy your lunch and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic but OK for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Panda27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Broadway Hotel 3 nights in January '08. From Changi Airport it takes about 20 minutes and S$ 22S to get there by taxi (incl. Night & Airport Surcharge). Since we arrived at 1am, there was no double-bed room available, although I had specificly booked one. The twin-bed room we stayed in the first night was disappointing: really old and small, with worn-out furnitures and carpets, and the bathroom facilities were in bad shape aswell. But we were offered to move to another room the next morning, which we did. The second room was quite ok, though very basicly equiped, about 12m² in size and rather clean, as were the sheets and towels. The bathroom is small and the water is running slow, but it's still clean enough to not make you feel uncomfortable. The rooms we stayed in were quite at night, due to the fact taht they were on the backside of the hotel. The streetside rooms, however, are said to be really noisy (the receptionists were honest about that fact), so you should avoid being put in one that is facing that side. There is NO Breakfast nor any meal service; there are, however, some (Indian) restaurants next to the entrance. The hotel is located in Little India, near an area of 24h-malls and bazars, which makes the streets busy and crowded day & night, but we still felt absolutely save there all the time. By taxi it takes 5-10 minutes to the city-center, and the subway-station is about 5 minutes of walking away. All in all the Broadway Hotel is not that bad, but you should't expect too much. The rooms and the whole hotel are old and worn, truely in need of renovation and refurbishing. But the stuff seemed to be friendly and helpful during our stay, and you should ask for another room if the one you got is just too shabby. So if you just need a (rather cheep) place to sleep and shower you may find this hotel quite ok, though it truely is no place for a romantic getaway ;-).

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Basic”
Reviews.Author: Keen_Bean_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Broadway at Singapore airport through the hotel booking agent, as was struggling to find anything else within budget. We ended up paying £40 a night for it - which isn't too bad I guess for Singapore. However, the room is like a cheap budget accommodation and extremely noisy. The room is OK - I have certainly stayed in worse places - but not in hotels who claim to be 3*! There is a bed, a bathroom with a shower (but no cubicle) and we had air con that dripped! There is no double glazing and we were kept awake all night by the traffic and loud booming noises from the restaurants and bars nearby. The location isn't too bad - about 5 minutes walk to the MRT to access all of the main areas - and taxis aren't too expensive. However, our taxi drivers tutted alot when we told them where we were staying and said that the Hotel 81 was much better and cheaper! (But NOT the ones in Geylang!). I would only book this hotel out of desperation - and would pack your earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “What ever you do do not book at the Broadway Hotel, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: ashillary
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked by the staff at the Changi airport for an overnight stay. The room was smelly and had provided, from the looks of it, used [i mean not washed] and worn out cotton linen. The toilet/shower was a disaster - the metal plumbing was hanging by a thread literally on the shower. The taps on the sink were so worn out they were just loosely twisting by themselves in their holes. There was drinking water provided but no tea/coffee or milk nor a refrigerator. I could not stand the smell of the room from the time I entered and could not wait till I got out of it the following morning. I went out and bought a pair of thongs so I could walk on the floor!! I think now you get the picture. Added to this was the rude and abrupt service provided by the staff at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “h8d n loved”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: welll basically it was my first tym 2 singapore. i am only 18 n i wanted a cheap hotel so i decided 2 stay in Broadway Hotel. i hated the receptionist. but not all are bad. some are really good especially da nite shift receptionist. as i was stayin on my own they gave me really good advise how to tour singapore safe. the room was ok i guess. the Tv was not workin properly, it wasnt really clear. i only got to watch channel 5 ( a singapore channel) n fashion tv( which was really boring) the bathroom made me sick. i didnt wana take a shower due to the broken tab. i saw another customer shotuing at the receptionist as his hot water was not working. thank god mine was ok. overall its ok but wouldnt saty there again. i would look for a better hotel near Orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Strange smell”
Reviews.Author: saira9
Reviews.Content: A very very basic, tired, rundown hotel, not very clean - dirty walls in room with coffee stains everywhere, dark dreary furniture and bathroom had no window?!?! Reception was very unhelpful. If you've ever stayed in a decent hotel, (4 or 5 star), you will absolutely hate it here....the only reason i stayed was because it was a very last minute internet booking and nothing else seemed available. Did walk out within 10 mins and try and book elsewhere, but no luck. Ended up stayin gout all hours and only coming in to sleep, it took several washes to get rid of the damp smell from my clothes and even my hand cream bottle stank a week later.... Location is good, but then thats down to singapore and its fantastic MRT system.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and suitable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Broadway is a clean cheap hotel, with friendly staff. Rooms are not exactly modern, without bath or shower cubicle, but rather shower in open bathroom area, in the Asian style. It was OK. The bed was comfy, water hot, cable TV etc., as advertised. It is in a great location, right in the heart of Little India, as the blurb says. Indian food everywhere near the hotel, at cheap prices, was excellent. Shopping overload on Serangoon Road, night markets and supermarkets nearby, beer stalls and buses, MRT stations close: one minute by train to Orchard Road. I'd stay there again for sure.

HotelInfo.Name: Broadway Hotel Singapore
HotelInfo.Address: 195 Serangoon Road | Orchard Road, Singapore, Singapore
